text:
Tomcat 3.2.3 Release Build downloaded directly from jakarta.apache.org
Java 2 SDK, Standard Edition Version 1.3.1_01 downloaded directly from 
java.sun.com
Microsoft Windows 2000 Professional for Intel Pentium with Service Pack 2

Problem description

Trying to use vbjorb.jar(of Borland Appserver 4.5.1) in a tomcat based 
application server. Not able to
 access any of the classes in this jar unless they are in the generic
classpath for the whole jvm. 
By making the vbjorb.jar part of the JVM's classpath, everything works just 
fine.
But has been unsuccessful in making vbjorb.jar accessible via the web-inf/lib 
directory.
of a particular WAR file.  Making vbjorb.jar accessible only via the web-inf/lib 
directory of a WAR file is a non-issue for the version of Tomcat shipped with 
Borland AppServer 4.5.1 since a requirement of Borland AppServer 4.5.1 is to 
have vbjorb.jar part of the classpath of the Borland Application Server. 

This case is actually a bug in  Tomcat's classloader
creator: dmathew@borland.com

text:
Loading classes from jar in WEB-INF/lib works for other JAR files so I don't 
know why your vbjorg.jar file would be any different.  I have seen problems 
with other JAR files (jacl.jar comes to mind) that had class loading bugs that 
required them to be loaded by the primordial class loader (hence they had to 
reside in tomcat/lib).  

If you can provide a small sample web application that demonstrates the problem 
I can look into it
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com

I haven't seen any response from the bug submitter and I can't duplicate the
